Ok ok NTR means being a cuck or having you're partner being stolen from you my bad all this time I thought NTR means just being a cuckold.

@The Mischievous Gentleman, shut up, you clearly don't know what you're talking about, stop spamming misinformation.  Netori(masu)寝取ます means to take, Netorare(ru) 寝取られる means to have something taken away, netorase(ru) 寝取らせる means to cause something to be taken.  It's just a verb with different conjugations that is reliant on the main topic.  There is no direct translation to "cuckold or cuckqueen"  Stop spreading your garbage.  I can tell that you plugged in NTR into google and just took the first translation.  Obviously has never asked a Japanese person what NTR means.

let's have some japanese education! netori is a verb, the act of stealing someone's partner by having sex with them. in this case, you (the mc/the subject) does the stealing. netorare is a conjugation of the aforementioned verb, called the passive form of the verb, when using this form, you (the mc/the subject) is on the receiving end of the verb, or it's being done to them by someone else. thank you for coming to my ted talk

yeah no netori doesnt mean cuckqueen, ntr is cuckold when the mc is the cuck or the cuck gets a major role in the story and we see his perspective. Netori is when the mc is the guy doing the cuckolding or we dont see the partner of the person getting fucked at all , more of a cheating thing rather than cuckold

From my perspective, is kinda tricky because the story starts with the youngs, but the actually MC is the mother, or at least the story is focused on her POV mainly. so that is why people say "is not NTR, is Netori" and other say that is a "good NTR" or "light NTR" because don't feel the same "sorrow" of the true NTRs. To be an actually NTR the story have to had the girl POV, but at this point we don't know if the girl have actually romantic feelings or just lust for the boy.

@Janus22 I know what you try to say, but try to look it this way. Aside of the genders, Netorare(NTR), Netori and Cheating ar different things, and that thing is the perspective. The same story have the three but the difference is who is telling the story, whose perspective is showing. If the POV is from th one whose parther was "stoled", is NTR. If the POV is from the one stealing, is Netori. And if POV is the one that "change" parther, is Cheating (Rape if is not consensual).
The problem is that a lot of stories upload here are tagged as NTR anyway. But sometimes is difficult realize why wich one is it.

If the author didn't focused so much on making nearly-shotas in EVERY doujin he does, it would be good. The mother's a cunt + shota + NTR is never a good combo

The funniest thing is to see the double standard these pushovers have. Girl NTR'ed? Street-belonging bitch. Guy NTR'ed? That's okay, ''it isnt hypocrisy, guys biology's is different, the guy is lucky'' yada yada. Just goes to show how little about sex a person that says this knows. Cheating is cheating dog, stop giving excuses for your weak mindset. That aside, the mom is really a cunt. She was already planning on cheating before the boy came along, she knows her daughter likes the guy and she is taking advantage on someone who clearly dont know shit about sex. It's also funny to see how differently NTR is potrayed by japanese authors when it's target its not the male: this is clearly a NTR story, but it has a light potraying, almost innocent looking, cuz it doesn't focus on diminishing the male in comparison to another, and it doesn't do that to the girl who is NTR'ed neither, cuz the author focused on the sex instead of storytelling, making the overall experience way less infuriating

Where are all of the hypocrites?  The guy isn't a whore?!  The guy is suppose to be loyal!  Even if they aren't dating!  The double standards people have are amazing.  It's amazing how much self awareness people lack.  Switch the roles and people would be flaming the girl to high heaven.  And by the way, It being called Netorare, Netori, Netorase is just dependent on the perspective of the main character.  At the end of the day it's just gerneralized as  netorare.  It's how uwakisare(ru), uwaki(shimasu), uwakisase(ru) is just cheating（浮気).  It's just different verb conjugations.
